name: HDR
body:
### Genesis Framework
Wordpress Frameworks extend core WordPress functionalities by exposing and then enhancing specific functionalities beyond their native purpose to create a specific type of theme usually for specific types of user. This type of development requires a parent and child theme relationship. We would develop the parent theme using the framework for functionality and create "skin" child themes with CSS styles for design/modification.

Pros | Cons
------------ | -------------
Framework + Starter Theme | Added cost $59.95
Themes can be used multiple times for clients |  Framework needs to be updated
Mobile responsive |  Learning curve - takes time to learn
Multi-language |  Dependent on parent/child theme relationship
Customizations won’t disappear (one-click software upgrade) | 
Speeds up development |  
Mobile responsive |  
Code library / extended functionalities |  
Support |  
SEO |  


### Wordpress Starter Theme (Barebones / Boilerplate)
We’ve crafted some handsome templates for you to use. Go ahead and click 'Continue to layouts' to browse through them. You can easily go back to edit your page before publishing. After publishing your page, you can revisit the page generator and switch to another theme. Your Page content will be preserved.

### Redux (advanced theme options panel)
If you prefer to not use the automatic generator, push a branch named `gh-pages` to your repository to create a page manually. In addition to supporting regular HTML content, GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features.
